content.description: Sit start on the right hand side of the boulder on a 2-3 finger pocket and slopey crimp. Dyno to the big jug on the lip. Don't dab your feet and don't roll off into the trees if you lose your grip during the whiplash!
content.location: Right side of the overhanging portion of the McKinney proper boulder about 15 feet past the arete

content.description: One of the few easy problems at Mckinney.  SDS off of low slopers.  Move to the slopers in the middle of "the Boulder". Finish sequence off another set of pinch-slopers before topping out.
content.location: On "the Boulder" just adjacent to the Project Wall.  Located on left-side of "the Boulder" when facing the cliff-band.  The problem is found on the center of the face.

content.description: Start Blur, matched on the flake, and go right. Stay left of Kentucky Dream. Using those holds as feet is fine though.
content.location: Far end of the project wall

content.description: Stand start on a small slot and move up to the right into a series of small pockets.  Continue up the face on alternating pockets and a small crimp before topping out.  The wall on the left is off.  Crux is the sustained climbing off small, sharp pockets.
content.location: Located on the right side of the project wall, to the back left corner of the face.  You will be directly facing the route when you stand right of the arete on the project wall with the Boulder on your right (Project wall on your left; the Boulder on your right).

content.description: Sit starting on a left undercling pocket & 2 right pockets, make a large move to a high pocket that is just left of center.  Reach up into another pocket (up and to the left) before moving into the sharp undercling (up and to the right).  Make one final move to the lip and top out.  **Height dependent**
content.location: Just left of the right arete, next to Blur.

content.description: Sit start on a chalked up crimp and undercling, down underneath and to the lower right of the base of the Arete. Move into the starting foothold (of the Arete) and a 2 finger pocket, and transition onto the starting pocket of the Arete. Finish the Arete.
content.location: On the detached boulder on the right side of the wall (when facing the cliff band).

content.description: Just on the face right of the arete on the project wall, stand start and climb off sloper edges up the face.  Climb off the sloper edges into some small pockets & a micro sidepull (on the right) up to the face.  Crux is the start.
content.location: Just right of the arete, just opposite of wolf spider on "the Boulder"

content.description: This is the sit start to Kentucky Dream. Sit start on a sloper and shallow pocket.  Climb off slopers into some small pockets & a micro sidepull up to the face.
content.location: Just right of the arete on the project wall, just opposite of Wolf Spider.

climbs.name: Houdini's Escape aka Arete Chicken Sit

content.description: Sit start to Arete Chicken.  Start on 'Neo-Classical Arete' and move from underneath to the slab; same finish as 'Arete Chicken'.
content.location: Found on the standalone boulder at the end of Project Wall.

content.description: long pumpy traverse( will update after I try it too lazy to brush the thing off last weekend)
content.location: Sit start far right on the standalone boulder, traverse the lip and top out same as the arete.

content.description: This is the sit start to Born to Drag.  Sit start on 2 small crimps, then move into the left pocket and right sidepull.  Dyno to the finish. ***Caution: there is a fallen tree at the base.  Take caution in properly protecting the landing.  Minimum 2 pads.***
content.location: SDS for Born to Drag, left side of Project Wall.  Tree is at the base. take caution in padding the area.

content.description: Start with both hands matched on the lowest rail directly underneath the sloping pocket. Go straight up the wall using the sloping pocket, upper rail, 3 finger pocket, and finally matching on the lip. Top out with mantle is possible and would slightly increase the grade but seemed sketchy given the large tree sticking out across the route. Please message me if this route has been previously documented from another source like a guidebook, etc.
content.protection: Pads on the ground and spotter by the tree.
content.location: About 30 feet to the left of Blur V9-V10 around the center of the Project Wall.

content.description: One move wonder.  Dyno off of a 2-finger left hand pocket and a right hand sidepull.
content.location: Located near left of center of the Project Wall.  There is a tree that is now at the base of the route.  Take caution in padding the route...

content.description: Start with low left-facing flake and climb the overhanging arete.
content.location: On the arete really close to the boulder.

content.description: Traverse up and left on big sharp flake to chossy mantle. Rock is suspect.
content.location: Left end of Project Wall.

content.description: Still a project, but I had to put it out there. Grade is just speculation.  I think hader than v10 whatever it ends up being . Start on miserable left hand pocket crimp and right on a sloping pocket , and throw for the lip.
content.location: 20 feet left of blur

content.description: Sit start on jug slots just left of whiplash, and traverse left into the Arete. Finish the Arete.
content.protection: Pad the Arete landing. Don’t bother padding up the problem since you’ll probably dab otherwise.
content.location: On the stand-alone boulder.

content.description: Start on Whip Lash pockets and climb into Bangarang. Finish Bangarang.
content.location: Low pocket and crimp about 20 feet past the arete under the overhang.

content.description: Hard for its grade.  SDS (with a left hand on the arete and a right hand jug inside the overhang) and climb the arete on incredibly polished limestone.  Multiple shallow pockets are available for heel hooks. Recommend climbing this in any season other than summer.
content.location: The obvious chalked arete on "the Boulder."

content.description: Starting on the Arete (V3), exit the route early onto the slab.  Hard for its grade.
content.location: The arete of McKinney boulder proper

content.description: When facing the wall, Project wall is right of Spacefarm and left/adjacent to the Boulder.
